question: The Manifold Pressure Gauge fitted to a supercharged engine measures:

choices.choice: The absolute pressure in the induction manifold.
The differential pressure across the supercharger compressor.
The ratio between the atmospheric pressure and the cam rise at the supercharger inlet.
The pressure upstream of the throttle valve.

subject: Technical

question: An Automatic Boost Control Unit:

choices.choice: Prevents detonation and dissociation in the cylinder.
Maintains an automatic preset boost pressure.
Maintains the correct mixture strength for the boost pressure set.
Sets the posiion of the waste gate to ensure the preset boost is maintained.

subject: Technical

question: The use of a turbo-charger on an engine will:

choices.choice: Raise the volumetric efficiency of the engine.
Cause an automatic rise in the engine R.P.M. as altitude is gained.
Cause an automatic rise in engine power as altitude is gained.

subject: Technical

question: The motive force used to drive the turbo-charger is:

choices.choice: Torque from the crankshaft via a spring drive unit.
Energy from the exhaust that would otherwise have been wasted.

subject: Technical

question: The power increase that occurs with initial increase in altitude when an engine has an internal supercharger fitted, is due to:

choices.choice: The reduced weight of mixture being passed to the engine.
The decreasing density of the atmosphere.

subject: Technical

question: Rated Altitude is:

choices.choice: The height at which the boost pressure ceases to be effective with a specific R.P.M. set.
A comparison between the boost pressure at sea level and that at a given altitude.
The maximum altitude at which Rated Boost can be maintained with a specific R.P.M. set.
The altitude at which the waste gate becomes fully shut.

subject: Technical

question: The speed of the turbine of a turbo-charger is controlled by:

choices.choice: Controlling the exit of the exhaust gas passing out of the eye of the impeller.
The use of a variable controller.
An automatic gearbox positioned between the turbine and the impeller.

subject: Technical

question: The turbo-charger waste gate is spring loaded towards:

choices.choice: A neutrally balanced partly open position.

subject: Technical

question: The turbo-charger bearing is lubricated and cooled by:

choices.choice: Its own internal self contained oil system.
A tapping in the scavenge oil system.

subject: Technical

question: Static Boost is:

choices.choice: Always the I.S.A. atmospheric pressure for the airfield altitude.
Obtained by opening the throttle to give a boost gauge reading of 30”He or 0 psi.
The boost pressure gauge reading when the engine is not running.Selecting a suitable throttle position will give the same boost gauge reading when the engine is running.
The difference between the induction manifold pressure and the exhaust manifold pressure.

subject: Technical

subject: Technical

question: In order to maintain a constant boost pressure with increasing altitude, the A.B.C.

choices.choice: Holds the throttle valve at a constant position.

subject: Technical

question: “Boost pressure” is the:

choices.choice: Inlet manifold pressure in pounds per square inch above or below standard mean sea level pressure.
Absolute pressure in the inlet manifold measured in inches of mercury.
Absolute pressure in the inlet manifold measured in millibars.
Inlet manifold pressure in pounds per square inch above or below atmospheric pressure.

subject: Technical

question: “Full Throttle Height” is:

choices.choice: The height at which the engine is at Rated Boost.
The maximum height at which a specified boost can be maintained at a specified R.P.M.
The height at which the waste gate is fully closed.
The cruising height for any specific boost.

subject: Technical

question: The purpose of an intercooler is:

choices.choice: To minimise the risk of detonation.
To increase the volume of the charge.
To decrease the density of the charge.
To prevent overheating of the exhaust manifold.

subject: Technical

question: The function of a diffuser in a supercharger is:

choices.choice: To decrease the temperature and increase the velocity of the charge.
To increase the velocity and decrease the pressure of the charge.
To decrease the velocity and decrease the pressure of the charge.
To decrease the velocity and increase the pressure of the charge.

subject: Technical

question: Air enters the compressor of a turbo-supercharger:

choices.choice: At the tip and passes across the impeller blades to exit at the eye.
At the diffuser and exits at the impeller.
At the eye and passes across the diffuser blades before exiting at the impeller tip.
At the eye and passes across the impeller blades to exit at the tip.

Between the engine block and the exhaust manifold.

choices.choice: Increase, but only in proportion to altitude increase.

question: A turbo-charger’s rotational speed is determined by:

choices.choice: The position of the throttle valve.
The density of the air at the compressor intake.

choices.choice: Unrestricted, but only if economical cruising power is set.
The maximum power the engine will give at any time.

choices.choice: Raise the temperature of the charge entering the cylinder.
Increase the mass of the charge entering the cylinder.
Improve the engine’s exhaust scavenging capability, and hence increase its power output.

choices.choice: Increase the thermal efficiency of the engine.
Increase the compression ratio of the engine.
Maintain sea level pressure in the engine to above rated altitude.

choices.choice: Incorporate a spring drive mechanism in the driving gears.
Rely on the inertia absorbing qualities of the exhaust gases.

The engine starts to suffer from detonation.

Increase to critical height and then remain constant.

Sometimes greater, sometimes less than the manifold pressure.

Enters at the periphery and leaves through the eye.

The waste gate must be closed.

The throttle valve must be closed.

question: The boost pressure of a turbo-charged engine is controlled by:

choices.choice: Varying the speed of the turbo-charger.

question: The effect of selecting Rated Boost, but less than Rated R.P.M. on the climb, would be that:

The Full Throttle Height would be less.
The Rated Altitude would be higher.
The Full Throttle Height would be higher.

choices.choice: The decrease in density due to the increase in altitude.
